pages.text: The art of witchcraft is commonly associated with a broom. However, that couldn't be further from the truth, as every witch knows that the most useful tool at its disposal is the cauldron. $(br2)This metal container might seem an ordinary piece of homeware, but in the hands of a skilled witch it is an essential instrument.

Indeed, many are the uses of a cauldron, ranging from potion making, to crafting, with a myriad other uses. $(br2)That said, before using the cauldron, a witch must firstly ensure that the cauldron itself has been properly set up. $(br2)This simple but crucial task is rather easy to do: you just need to fill the cauldron up through the use of a water bucket $(o)(although rumor has it there are other ways of
$(o)automatically filling up the cauldron$()), and heat the cauldron with a heat source, magical or otherwise...
